de.dfki.lt.hfc

Class Relation

  • java.lang.Object
    • de.dfki.lt.hfc.Relation
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    Function, Predicate

    public abstract class Relation
extends java.lang.Object
    the abstract superclass of the two classes Predicate and Function
    Since:
    JDK 1.5

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      int[] args
      the arguments to the relation are either variables, URIs, or XSD atoms; variables are represented by negative integers, all other objects by positive ints

      the name of the relation instance
      Operator op
      the functional or relational operator for this object, given the fully-qualified relation/Java class name

      represents a mapping from relational ids to their functional counterparts; note that relational variables in tests and actions might even be complex, leading to the array list in this data structure; note that brand-new unique IDs are already assigned to complex relational variables, such as ??(var1 ...
      java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,java.lang.Integer> varToId
      needed by predicates (@test) and functions (@action) to properly access the content of binding tables when using (complex) relational variables (??-vars)

    • Field Detail

      • name

        public java.lang.String name
        the name of the relation instance

      • op

        public Operator op
        the functional or relational operator for this object, given the fully-qualified relation/Java class name
        See Also:
        name

      • args

        public int[] args
        the arguments to the relation are either variables, URIs, or XSD atoms; variables are represented by negative integers, all other objects by positive ints

      • pos

        public int[] pos
        pos is used to map the args array (variable names & constants) to an array where the variable names are replaced by the positions in the binding table to which the relation is applied; note that this mapping must be established w.r.t. to such a table and is only valid when this relation is applied; note further that the positions are encoded by _negative_ ints in order to distinguish them from the literals (positive ints)

      • relIdToFunIds

        public java.util.HashMap<java.lang.Integer,java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.Integer>> relIdToFunIds
        represents a mapping from relational ids to their functional counterparts; note that relational variables in tests and actions might even be complex, leading to the array list in this data structure; note that brand-new unique IDs are already assigned to complex relational variables, such as ??(var1 ... varN) id(??var) -> [id(?var)] id(??(var1 ... varN)) -> [id(var1), ..., id(?varN)]

      • varToId

        public java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,java.lang.Integer> varToId
        needed by predicates (@test) and functions (@action) to properly access the content of binding tables when using (complex) relational variables (??-vars)
